intro: Thlaspi hirtum, commonly known as hairy rockcress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or mountainous regions. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in clusters, while its leaves are hairy and lobed. Thlaspi hirtum is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
